name: Framebuffer.bash
tagline: framebuffer in bash to draw ascii pixels, borders, animate e.g. (bash ui bootstrap)
body:
### Why

For minimalists and productivity fanatics.
The console is sometimes 'good enough' compared to fullfledged client/server html/css/javascript ui's.

### plugins/Barchart

will produce something like this:

    stock:  ——▄▄▀▀——▀▀▄▄——▄▄▀▀▄▄———
 
    rates:  __▄▄██__██▄▄__▄▄██▄▄___
 
    redis:  ▀▀▄▄▀▀▄▄▀▀▀▀———————————

by simply using:

    put 2 3 "stock:"; echo "0,1,2,0,2,1,0,1,2,1" | barchart 10 2 20 
    put 2 5 "rates:"; echo "0,1,2,0,2,1,0,1,2,1" | OFFSET=3 barchart 10 4 20 
    put 2 7 "redis:"; redis-cli --csv LRANGE foo 0 -1 | sed 's/[^0-9,\\-]*//g' | barchart 10 6 20
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
